description: The function 'draw_parallelogram_with_height' generates a visual representation of a parallelogram with a specified height. It is designed to aid in the understanding of geometry, specifically the properties and characteristics of parallelograms.

stimulus_type_specification.title: Available Images: Parallelogram with Height
stimulus_type_specification.description: The 'draw_parallelogram_with_height' function is capable of generating a variety of parallelogram images with specified heights. The function accepts input from the 'ParallelogramWithHeight' class, which includes parameters such as the base, sides, and height of the parallelogram. The function is constrained by the properties of a parallelogram, meaning the input values must be able to form a valid parallelogram. The primary educational purpose of this function is to provide a visual aid for understanding the properties of parallelograms, such as how the base, sides, and height relate to each other.

details: The 'ParallelogramWithHeight' class, which includes parameters for the base, sides, and height of the parallelogram
Each parameter controls the corresponding aspect of the parallelogram
All fields are required for the function to draw a valid parallelogram
The input values must be able to form a valid parallelogram
The function validates the input by checking if the base, sides, and height can form a parallelogram
There are no specific value limits or ranges, but the values must be positive
The function draws a parallelogram with a specified height
There are no variations or options available
The size and shape of the parallelogram are determined by the input parameters
